concept.title: Installing the HTTP Module for Tomcat
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes how to install the HTTP session management module for Tomcat.

ol.li: If you do not already have Tomcat installed, download Tomcat 6.0 or 7.0 from the Apache Website.

li.p: The HTTP Session Management Module for Tomcat is included in the Pivotal installation package. After you install , you can find the module in the following location: <product_dir>/tools/Modules/Pivotal_GemFire_Modules-8.X.X-Tomcat.zipwhere <product_dir> is the location where you installed and 8.X.X corresponds to the version of the module you are installing.

ol.li: Unzip the module into the $CATALINA_HOME directory or wherever you installed the application server.

Copy the following JAR files to the lib directory of your Tomcat server ($CATALINA_HOME/lib).
$GEMFIRE/lib/gemfire.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/antlr.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/spring-core-3.2.12.RELEASE.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/spring-shell-1.0.0.RELEASE.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/log4j-api-2.1.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/log4j-core-2.1.jar
